newsitem.title: CANADA: FREESTYLE SKIING-BECKER RULES WORLD CUP ACRO EVENT.
newsitem.headline: FREESTYLE SKIING-BECKER RULES WORLD CUP ACRO EVENT.

text.p: Fabrice Becker of France dominated the feestyle skiing field for the second week in a row, winning the World Cup acro event on Friday.
Heini Baumgartner of Switzerland was second and veteran Ian Edmondson of the United States third.
Becker, who also won in acro last week in Lake Placid, outpointed Baumgartner 26.65 points to 26.15. The Swiss, however, still leads the overall standings in acro, the event formerly called ballet.
Elena Batalava of Russia continued her march toward another expected World Cup overall acro title in the women's final.
Batalava scored 25.80, while Swedes Annika Johansson and Asa Magnussen were second and third with respective totals of 25.15 and 24.60.
The moguls event will be contested on Saturday with aerials on Sunday.
